根據外媒的報導，英特爾計劃發布一款高端桌面處理器i9-9990XE，內部文件稱這款處理器不進行零售，而是拍賣賣給OEM廠商。

replies.msg:
英特爾將這款處理器列入了“非路線圖產品”，這意味著它不會進入零售市場。英特爾不會直接向終端用戶銷售該產品，而是通過一系列拍賣將其提供給選定的OEM，每季度舉行一次，第一次拍賣計劃在2019年的第三週舉行。

需要注意的是這款芯片擁有255W的TDP，這意味著峰值功率將更高，適用於 X299主板，另外英特爾不提供任何保修。

G-SYNC Compatible Support

replies.msg:
Euro gamer 寫：

At the tail-end of last week, Capcom delivered a multi-platform release of the Resident Evil 2 Remake - the so-called ‘1-shot’ demo that gives users just 30 minutes to play a very small portion of the full game. It‘s shaping up to be a beautiful game that sees the consoles push higher-end features of the foundation RE engine for the first time, and it also sees the developer make some fascinating technical choices for both the vanilla and enhanced consoles. Meanwhile, the PC version opens up a vast array of possible settings, but based on the experience the demo delivers, the top-end experience does require some meaty hardware.

quote.msg: 我開盡佢vram 都無野 似乎流流地

replies.msg:
呢段先啱：

One curiosity about the PC version concerns the demo’s VRAM meter, which is designed to offer up an idea of the amount of memory required to run the game at your current settings. At 4K resolution, this can hit a giddy 15GB (!), but in the here and now at least, I suspect that this may be inaccurate. The demo doesn‘t exactly run well at 4K on a GTX 1060 6GB (20-30fps at max settings) but there’s none of the stutter associated with texture swapping. Having tested 6GB, 8GB and 11GB graphics cards, the game seems to stream in assets according to how much VRAM is available, topping out at around 9.5GB on an RTX 2080 Ti. How this will all extend to the final game and more expansive environments remains to be seen. The same applies to the demo‘s DX12 implementation - this currently has a severe performance penalty on both AMD and Nvidia hardware, and I hope to see improvement here in the final build.

replies.msg:
尋日咪貼咗eurogamer 講呢件事囉

One curiosity about the PC version concerns the demo’s VRAM meter, which is designed to offer up an idea of the amount of memory required to run the game at your current settings. At 4K resolution, this can hit a giddy 15GB (!), but in the here and now at least, I suspect that this may be inaccurate. The demo doesn’t exactly run well at 4K on a GTX 1060 6GB (20-30fps at max settings) but there’s none of the stutter associated with texture swapping. Having tested 6GB, 8GB and 11GB graphics cards, the game seems to stream in assets according to how much VRAM is available, topping out at around 9.5GB on an RTX 2080 Ti. How this will all extend to the final game and more expansive environments remains to be seen. The same applies to the demo’s DX12 implementation - this currently has a severe performance penalty on both AMD and Nvidia hardware, and I hope to see improvement here in the final build.

Just download "Intelligent standby list cleaner ISLC" thats a programm who clear standby list every time the free memory is lower than 1gb.

this programm works very well and fixed stuttering in almost all games.﻿

o fix this issue - you have to clean or purge your standby list. You can do it by hand of course or using a smart tool. It's called "Intelligent Standby List Cleaner".
It's rlly simple to use and working like a charm.


https://www.wagnardsoft.com/content/intelligent-standby-list-cleaner-v1000-released


CONCLUSION

I tried everything before - like manipulating some registries, switched hardware components, used different ingame configs and other party softwares - this list of dumb fixes goes on and on.
I'm rlly happy now I fixed my laggy stuttering. Many people complaining about the 2080 TI or even the 20x series. Maybe the drivers aren't working right now? <- yes of course, its a new piece of hardware. But I think many people having the "Win10 Standby List Bug".

Please come here and write your experience. I will correct by bad English piece by piece - I'm tired as a mouse. But try to give the community some tips and solutions.

Did this fix worked for you?
Did you use smth. else to fix it?

Greetings from Germany and good night

https://ezone.ulifestyle.com.hk/article/2170773/Ace%20Combat%207電腦版更靚%20將對應8K級數畫質%E2%80%A7不鎖幀速


Ace Combat 7電腦版更靚 將對應8K級數畫質‧不鎖幀速



久違多時的空戰遊戲《空戰奇兵7 未知天際》（Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown）決定在2019年1月推出，甚至會有專用飛行控制桿推出，近日官方公開ＰＣ版本的特點，將會比ＰＳ４ ＰＲＯ更靚，對應到8K級數畫質及不鎖幀速。

《空戰奇兵7 未知天際》（Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown）確定在2019年1月17日推出，在ＰＳ４平台上不單會有HORI製的專用飛行控制桿同日上市，更會設有ＰＳＶＲ專用的頭盔模式。今集強調仔細的天空渲染，雲層更是今集空戰中十分重要的元素，自機及敵人都可以利用雲層進行掩護。


近日官方公布了遊戲的PC Steam版本特點，遊戲將會和ＮＶＩＤＩＡ緊密合作，優化最新的電腦遊戲顯示卡執行效率，故遊戲不單對應最高４Ｋ解像度，亦會有更高級的渲染畫質可自行設定，甚至先高階的內部渲染縮放功能，最高可設定２００％。換句話說，在４Ｋ解像度使用２００％染縮放，畫面即等同８Ｋ級別。同時遊戲亦不設幀速限制，一般遊戲只有３０／６０ＦＰＳ限幀，在高階電腦系統及電競顯示器下，《空戰奇兵7 未知天際》可望達到120FPS或以上。官方又透露了PC版本的建議配備如下:

CPU: Intel Core i5-7500或以上
GPU: GeForce GTX 1060 3GB或以上
RAM: 8GB
OS: Windows 7, Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 (64-bit versions)
HDD: 60GB free space
DirectX: Version 11


官方宣稱此配置已經可以在 1920x1080高畫質得到 100 FPS水平，甚至於2560x1440有 60 FPS，但在 4K環境的話，官方就建議採用GeForce GTX 1080 Ti、RTX 2080 Ti或RTX 2080 取得穩定的60 FPS以上遊戲表現。如果大家的系統比較舊，仍可參考基本配置要求：

CPU: Intel Core Intel Core i3-7100或以上
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050／GeForce GTX 750 Ti或以上
RAM: 4GB
OS: Windows 7, Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 (64-bit versions)
HDD: 60GB free space
DirectX: Version 11
